Commit Message:
Initial commit

Version 1.0.0 of httpstan. Includes Stan 2.19.1 in httpstan/lib/stan.
fix: Remove unused script
fix: Remove MinGW hypot fix, unneeded after Python 3.7.2
fix: Update requirements, remove ujson
style: run cpplint
build: Fix `poetry build` for wheel building
docs: Update Changelog for 1.1
fix: Do not overwrite LD_LIBRARY_PATH
docs: Trim required packages for docs building

style: Follow Django's Coding Style line length recommendations

Closes #279
docs: Fix minor docs typos and problems
docs: Add note about who has non-shared accounts

docs: Fix wording

Closes #270
docs: Fix typos in "Getting Started" instructions
style: Run black with new line length setting

fix: Adjust gcc ABI compatibility settings

Closes #294
docs: Add release notes for 1.1.1

ci: add codecov

Add codecov.yml file to setup codecov behaviour and add changes to
.travis.yml file.
fix: Update version numbers

ci: Stop using appveyor

We don't support Windows right now.
docs: Update readthedocs requirements

ci: Test on macOS

Test only on default Python 3 on macOS.

docs: Update development instructions

Contains other minor documentation improvements as well.

Closes #247
Closes #284

fix: Give models from different `python`s distinct ids

Previously, a model built under Python 3.8 would receive
the same id as a model built under Python 3.7.

Move to base32 encoding of ids instead of hex. This makes the
identifiers 20% shorter.

Closes #288
docs: Update documentation with new hash encoding

docs: Check that new release does not break pystan

Closes #299

test: Check that progress logger callback is being called

Closes #277
style: run isort, add black-compatible config

fix: Improve Exception messages

The previous code used `str(exc)` which does not display the Exception
type. The new message is much more informative. It also now includes
traceback information.

One additional test added.

Closes #275

test: increase testing cases

Implements new tests for failures.

gitignore: update .gitignore

Add poetry.lock and htmlcov to .gitignore
fix: Minor build config fixes

fix: Relax python version requirement

Poetry runs into dependency resolution problems with the previous
Python version specification (3.7.3). Relaxing the Python version
may help resolve the problem.
feat: Bump version to 1.1.2

fix: Drop test checking version number

The original test wasn't a terribly useful check.
A more automated way of updating the version would be welcome.

ci: Use cache to avoid downloading tarballs

Downloading protobuf and Stan seem to cause build failures periodically.
These downloads can be cached.

feat: Add support for CVODES-requiring Stan models

Closes #311

ci: Make minor adjustment to travis script

Possible fix for macOS timeout.
ci: Properly record test exit codes

Revert "feat: Add support for CVODES-requiring Stan models"

This reverts commit 30bb10f603b4f75066689c66b7a96e04c7b4ccdc.

ci: Make travis-ci config more robust

This should make it harder to accidentally introduce a configuration
which allows test failures to go unnoticed.

feat: Add support for CVODES-requiring Stan models

This is the second attempt. The first attempt was reverted.

No code here deserves special comment. The Makefile rules for building
sundials are taken from CmdStan.

Closes #311

fix: Remove unnecessary Stan version information

Knowing the version of httpstan tells us what version of Stan is in use.
Stan version information is redundant.

This commit eliminates 28 unnecessary lines of code. Removing `stan.pyx`
simplifies building the httpstan wheel.
ci: Mark issues stale after 30 days.

fix: Clean up and reorganize Makefile rules

This makes the Makefile rules much better organized.
In particular, the httpstan Makefile now uses Stan Math's Makefile rules
to build the shared libraries used by Stan Math. This relieves httpstan
developers of the burden of maintaining complex Makefile rules.

Also adjusts the CI cache directory so builds are independent.

fix: Run stan::services functions in background using ProcessPool

Use a ProcessPoolExecutor instead of a ThreadPoolExecutor when
calling long-running stan::services functions.

Virtually all the changes in this commit follow from this change.
Switching to use a Unix domain socket to pass information from
subprocesses to the main process is required because the previous
method involved sharing memory between threads. Since we no longer
use threads, we cannot share memory in this way.

Remove the `PRAGMA journal_mode=WAL` setting for sqlite3 to avoid issues
associated with accessing the sqlite3 database from different processes.

Since we cannot use Windows currently due to the use of Unix domain sockets,
remove the custom `TemporaryDirectory` in favor of the standard library version.

ci: Drop support for macOS

macOS appears to have a less generous limit on the number of messages
which can be queued in a Unix domain socket.

This commit can be reverted when a macOS solution is developed.
One possible fix: send UDP messages via localhost.

fix: Improve Makefile rules

Previous Makefile rules had flaws that led to targets being rebuilt
unnecessarily.

fix: Simplify socket code, select module not needed

Stan C++ sends us data via the Unix domain socket. We do not need to use
select to wait until there is data to receive.

This version is simpler. It also strongly resembles the code used
when we waited on a thread-safe boost queue.

ci: Update travis config

Use the new version that travis-ci.com asks for.

fix: Use stream instead of datagram over socket

Sending datagram messages (Ã  la UDP) is extremely convenient. The code
was readable. Unfortunately, macOS has a very small send buffer. The
Stan logger and writer callbacks (which send us draws) send a lot of
messages and exceed the capacity of the buffer on macOS.

So we use the stream protocol instead. Stan will have to wait until we
are ready to send us draws.

Revert "ci: Drop support for macOS"

This reverts commit 97eee3aabef8fef92016edd52cafd24ac80f5aac.

fix: Close sockets when an exception occurs during sampling

If a C++ exception occurs during the stan::services call (e.g.,
initialization failure) we need to close the sockets which send Stan
messages to httpstan. This is important because failing to close them
might mean there are lingering messages which are never received.  These
messages will likely contain information relevant to figuring out why
the exception occurred.

fix: Flush messages_file after stan services call returns

The correct place to flush the messages file is after the stan services
call has returned. Flushing it before that point does not make as much
sense.

This change is made out of an abundance of caution about possible race
conditions.

docs: Remove changelog

The changelog will be automatically generated from commit messages in
the future. Updating it manually is a conspicuous waste of developer time.

fix: Use importlib, not deprecated pkg_resources

The functionality provided by `pkg_resources` now exists in the Python
standard library. Use of `pkg_resources` is deprecated. See the
`importlib` documentation for more details.

Closes #269

ci: Fix for macOS build timeout on travis

Compiling httpstan sometimes takes longer than 10 minutes on macOS.
Use `travis_wait` to extend timeout to 20 minutes.
fix: Add reminder to remove fix after stanc3

fix: Use order-only prerequisites for dirs in Makefile

Using directories as targets in a Makefile creates problems.
We use order-only prerequisites to solve this problem.
The problem and the solution are discussed here:
https://stackoverflow.com/a/13418059

Closes #343

chore: Update version

This will be the last version of httpstan which uses Stan 2.19.
1.1.3 differs from 1.1.2 in that it uses process-based parallelism
instead of thread-based parallelism. This may have performance
implications for models which can draw all their samples very quickly
(e.g., in a couple of seconds).

fix: Include built shared libraries in wheel

Fixes a typo in the previous version. The previous version was: `libsundials.*`.
This misses all the files we want since they have the following filenames:

httpstan/lib/libsundials_cvodes.a
httpstan/lib/libsundials_idas.a
httpstan/lib/libsundials_kinsol.a
httpstan/lib/libsundials_nvecserial.a

chore: Update version

Includes fix to include shared libraries in the wheel.

feat: Update Stan to 2.23.0 and Stan Math to 3.2.0

This update is significant. Stan Math now requires the Intel TBB
library.

test: "Resolve" flaky tests under clang

When `clang` is used as the compiler, several tests are flaky. That is,
they fail when run with the entire test suite but pass when run by
themselves.

These flaky tests disappear if every test is run in a separate process.
There is a pytest plugin which does this. We use it when `clang` is used
as the compiler.

feat: Use stanc3 binary

Download and install stanc ("stanc3") binary (written in OCaml).
Development of the C++ compiler has ceased.

Closes #333

fix: Disable failing index error test faute de mieux

Before switching to stanc3 this exception was successfully received by
Cython. Now it appears there is a segfault instead.

Unfortunately, there is no time available to debug this problem. Users
who write Stan program with index errors will not receive informative
error messages.

ci: Remove unneeded travis_wait

We do not need travis_wait since we do not compile `stanc`.

fix: Include stanc in package

stanc is ignored in `.gitignore`, so poetry does not include it
unless instructed to.

fix: Use correct path to stanc binary

The full path to the stanc binary needs to be used in order to run the
stanc executable. Since the stanc binary could be installed anywhere, we
must retrieve the path using `importlib`.

chore: Update version

Increasing from 1.x to 2.x because of the shift to stanc3. While in
theory stanc3 is backward compatible there may be unexpected changes.

ci: Build and install wheel, then run tests

Previously we tested in an environment which might be called poetry's
"developer mode". Now we build a wheel, install the wheel, and test.
Running tests in this sort of environment is better because the
environment resembles the one users will have.

Closes #365

fix: Pin mypy-protobuf version, update mypy

The newest version of mypy-protobuf 1.22 generates type annotations
which mypy does not recognize as valid.

Closes #377

fix: Fix wheel building with empty extension module

The wheel building and repairing machinery recognizes packages as
containing platform-specific modules by the presence of distutils
Extension metadata. This commit adds an empty extension module so the
wheel building machinery is not confused. (httpstan has
platform-specific content (shared libraries) but no build-time extension
modules.)
chore: Bump version

test: Simplify test fixtures

Big simplification of test setup thanks to pytest-asyncio.
No need for running the server in a separate thread.

test: Remove unused pytest setting

The previous commit makes the `--forked` isolation flag unnecessary.

Create FUNDING.yml (add github sponsors info on behalf of SGB)

[ci skip]

refactor: Move build_ext.run() to separate module

The use of distutils to compile the Stan model extension module is
a (complicated) independent step. Putting this code in a separate
module makes this clear and makes `models.py` easier to read.

refactor: Use cache_db_filename for clarity

There's a cache directory and a cache database. `cache_db_filename` is a
better variable name.
fix: Remove unused sql table
fix: Include traceback in build exception message

feat: Build services module in cache destination

Build the model-specific stan::services extension module in the cache
directory. This eliminates the need to save the module in a database and
copy it into a temporary directory every time it is used.

This commit also renames some functions to make clear the distinction
between the extension module (which wraps stan::services functions)
and the C++ Stan model (generated by stanc).
chore: Bump version

fix: Do not download stanc silently

CI tests periodically fail due to some sort of problem with the `stanc`
executable. With this commit, stanc will be downloaded without
`-silent`.

Also added --retry and --fail which may help with transient errors.

Closes #380

chore: Update sphinx version

No problems expected here.

Closes #391

fix: Update autoapi_ignore list

Use of wildcard now follows autoapi instructions.
Previously, it appeared that httpstan/callbacks_writer_pb2.py
was not being ignored.

style: Run black

Previously black was not being run on Python files inside `doc`.

docs: Align docs with PyStan

One significant change here. "How to contribute" is moved into pystan.
The code contribution standards are the same for httpstan and pystan.

fix: Remove unused Cython code

stanc3 is used now, compile.pyx concerns stanc2.

fix: Fix include globs for shared libraries

The previous globs included files which should not be included,
e.g., a file `libprotobuf-lite.la`.

fix: Remove hard-coded LC_ID_DYLIB on macOS

macOS shared libraries have a LC_ID_DYLIB path which is
fixed at compile time. Since we move the protobuf shared library after
compiling it, this creates problems. This commit fixes the problem.

chore: Update version to 2.0.3

Update version to 2.0.3. macOS wheels should be fixed.

feat: Remove Cython build dependency

Remove inconvenient build-time dependency on Cython.
Cython is used by httpstan to wrap the model-specific stan::services
functions. Cython was also used to build a module "empty" whose
only purpose was to force the Python wheel building tools to
recognize the httpstan wheel as platform-specific (which it is due
to the presence of shared libraries in `httpstan/lib`).

Closes #399

fix: Update to poetry 1.1

Poetry 1.1 asks for a new `[build-system]` block:

[build-system]
requires = ["poetry_core>=1.0.0"]
build-backend = "poetry.core.masonry.api"

fix: Store current operations in memory

Store current operations in memory, not in sqlite. There is
no need to persist operations. Using sqlite is virtually
certain to be slower. Using sqlite also adds complexity:
creating the table, opening and closing a connection.

We do not use threads so there is no thread-safety
concern.
fix: Remove pre Python 3.7 ensure_future

refactor: Write fit messages in single place

The services_stub.call function takes responsibility for
writing the messages it gets from Stan to disk. Previously
the `call` function did some writing but closing the buffer
was handled elsewhere.

Closes #352

fix: Do not starve asyncio loop during sampling

Avoid effectively blocking the asyncio loop during sampling by
`sleep`ing briefly when there are no messages to process. Previously
`select` would completely monopolize the CPU until sampling had
completed. As a result, the server would not process simple GET
requests, including the request to learn the current sampling progress.
With this change, such requests are processed.

fix: Performance improvement in `select` loop

Make minor adjustment which seem to help with performance.
The `select` loop in services_stub is reading messages from Stan
which can come in extraordinarily quickly or very slowly depending
on how complicated the model is. If they are coming in quickly we need
to read them as quickly as possible.

Setting the timeout to 0.01 in the call to `select` means
spending a bit more time waiting for the next message rather
than `sleep`ing via the asyncio loop. Odds are that what we want is
the next message from Stan, so making the timeout 0.01 rather than 0
means we will spend more time waiting for what we likely want.

This, at least, is how I explain the fact that this seems to help a bit
empirically.
chore: Bump version

fix: Remove limit on client POST payload size

Default `client_max_size` is 1 MiB. Model `data` is often greater. None
removes limit.

Closes #417
Closes #416

test: Pin pytest to 5.x

The pytest requirement should never have been removed.
Tests break in pytest 6.x.
chore: Bump version

feat: Update Stan version to 2.24.0

Update to Stan 2.24.0. Update version numbers.

fix: Update for new stanc error messages

Adjust text of stanc error messages in tests.
chore: Bump version

refactor: Align Cython code better with CmdStan

Make minor changes to better align Cython code with Cmdstan's
command.hpp. If and when people are interested in understanding how this
wrapping code works it will be helpful to have all code which
does the same thing look approximately the same. For example,
CmdStan references the model with an instance of model_base, so now we
do as well. No changes here change behavior.

fix: Remove unused code

Remove old Cython code which is no longer used.

fix: Fix type for mypy

Specify type of argument to subprocess.run. Resolves what appears to be
a mypy glitch.

feat: Return stanc warning messages

Return stanc warning messages when stanc compiles Stan program code
successfully. Previously program code which compiled successfully
with warnings would raise an exception.

Closes #349
Closes #273

feat: Add debug mode

Add a debug mode which can be enabled via the HTTPSTAN_DEBUG environment variable.
If `HTTPSTAN_DEBUG` is set, httpstan will not run sampling calls in a
background thread or process. This makes debugging via `gdb` much
easier.

Closes #390

chore: Bump stanc3 version

Fix in stanc3 for a stanc3 bug. See
https://discourse.mc-stan.org/t/a-bug-with-elementwise-pow-in-the-2-24-release/17194/10

ci: Remove codecov.yml

ci: codecov.yml is removed, which means that codecov won't send updated to PR, but developer can still see the current line-use sitution in https://codecov.io/gh/stan-dev/httpstan

ci: Remove unused installation of macos findutils

Previously, the Linux version of `find` was installed for macOS.
This version is no longer needed. We can use the BSD `find`.

fix: Use int value for `client_max_size`

aiohttp accepts requests which have at most `client_max_size` bytes.
`client_max_size` must be an integer, not `None`.

Setting this value to the absurdly high value of 512 GiB.
If users are fitting models on with this much data they likely
know enough to patch httpstan.

Closes #417

ci: Remove unused coverage config, docs

Remove unused codecov line in travis config.
Remove reference to unused coveralls service in docs.

fix: Replace tox with shell script

Replace tox with a simpler shell script. This project
does not use tox in the way it is traditionally used,
to test different versions of Python. Tox is only
used to lint code in the repository. This job
can be better accomplished by a shell script.

Closes #325
style: Run black and isort
fix: Remove mypy redundant typing

ci: Workaround travis not failing on nonzero exit

Workaround for travis not failing if a shell script exits with a nonzero
exit code.

feat: compress cache

Use gzip to compress and decompress cache

feat: informative compile filename

Use informative scheme for temporary filename in compile function.
Add "--warn-pedantic" in stanc call.

test: add seed

Add seed for linear regression test

fix: Update webargs to version 6

This newer version of webargs resolves a long-standing validation
issue.

refactor: Dump takes dumped as first argument

Fixes signature of `dump_fit`. Python users familiar
with `json.dump` expect the first argument to be the thing-to-be-saved
and the second argument to be the place-where-thing-is-saved.

fix: Build function now does (only) one thing

Functions should have a single responsibility.
`build_services_extension_module` now narrowly
builds the service extension module.
Previously, it built the module and also saved
the compiler output to the cache location.

docs: Fix typo in docstring

Docstring indicated wrong return type.

fix: Save stanc messages in cache

stanc messages must be saved in the cache, just like
the C++ compiler output is saved in the cache.

Also removes two related simple helper functions. Functions call compile
(which runs `stanc`) now, picking the output they need.

Closes #449

refactor: Tidy order of create model view

New arrangement makes more sense logically and
avoids a deeply nested block.

docs: Update README to reflect current version

Updates required Python version. Representation
of model information also updated.

Closes #456

fix: Standardize view name for create models

The create fit function name is `handle_create_fit`. The function
for creating a model should follow the same pattern.

feat: Add list_models endpoint

Allows users to list models in cache. REST APIs
typically offer such a list.

Such a list is required if a user wants to delete
all models from the cache. This is because, without
this function, there is no way for the user to know
what models are in the cache. Models must be referred
to by name in order to delete them.

Closes #409

feat: Allow users to delete a model

Allow users to delete a model. Deleting a model
also removes all associated fits.

feat: Allow users to delete fits

Allow users to delete fits saved in cache.

Closes #435
docs: Fix incorrect docstrings

refactor: Correct variable name

Correct the fits_path variable name. The
variable refers to a directory called `fits`
which contains data concerning all fits (plural)
associated with the model.

ci: Hotfix, avoid poetry 1.1.0

Bug which affects `poetry export` is unfixed in 1.1.0.
Fixed in future releases. See poetry#3018

feat: Remove Cython code, use pybind11 instead

Remove all Cython code, replacing the code with
C++ (using pybind11).

One feature which Cython supported that pybind11 does not is function
signature inspection.  Whereas you can call
`inspect.Signature.from_callable` on a Cython-defined function, you
cannot do this with pybind11-defined functions.
So we fall back to parsing the docstring.

Closes #403

style: clang-format C++ files

This commit formats C++ files with:

clang-format -i -style="{ColumnLimit: 119}"

tests: Add a couple of tests

Add a couple of tests. Test coverage remains about 93%.

ci: Verify that httpstan does not break pystan

Verify that httpstan does not break pystan by
importing pystan and sampling from a simple model.

feat: Precompile callbacks_writer.pb.cc

Precompile httpstan/callbacks_writer.pb.cc.
This will speed up compilation of model-specific
extension modules.

Closes #464

feat: Precompile stan_services.cpp

Precompile httpstan/stan_services.cpp.
This will speed up compilation of model-specific
extension modules.

style: Trim whitespace in Makefile

Trim trailing whitespace in Makefile.

ci: Update CI config for Python 3.9

Use Ubuntu 20.04 for tests and add Python 3.9.

Newer versions of poetry do not export dev-dependencies extras

chore: Bump version

Bump version.

fix: Use g++ instead of gcc when pre-compiling

Use g++ instead of gcc when pre-commpiling C++ code.
This does not appear to matter with gcc 9.3 but may
matter with older versions of gcc.

feat: Show compiler args when debug mode is on

Previously the invocations of the compiler and linker
were not shown.

ci: Update stale bot config

Stale bot does not seem to be working. Use a standard config. Perhaps it
will fix the problem.

chore: Use newer versions of packages

- apispec

Choice of numpy 1.16 reflects:

https://numpy.org/neps/nep-0029-deprecation_policy.html

fix: Remove hard-coded shared library version

Remove hard-coded shared library version from Makefile.  Only affects
macOS.

feat: Update Stan to 2.25.0 release candidate.

Update Stan to 2.25.0 release candidate.

test: Verify missing data raises exception

Verify that failing to provide a variable defined in the `data` block
raises the appropriate exception.

See https://github.com/stan-dev/pystan-next/issues/137 for original
report.

feat: Update Stan to 2.25.0

Update Stan to 2.25.0.

chore: Bump version

Bump version.

This commit should have been combined with the previous commit.

BREAKING CHANGE: Use bytes not strings in protobuf messages

Use `bytes` not `string`s in Protocol Buffers messages. According to the
protocol buffers specification, `string`s may only be used when one can
guarantee that the underlying bytes are valid UTF-8.  (We use C++
`std::string`s and perform no checking that anything is valid UTF-8.)
According to the spec, we must use Protocol Buffer `bytes`.

This may address a mysterious bug on macOS that seems to involve
a failure in the encoding (or decoding) of a protocol buffer message.

This is a breaking change since we are changing the protocol buffer
schema.

test: Verify (de)serialization of nan, inf, -inf

Verify that nan, inf, and -inf values are correctly
serialized.

chore: Bump version

Bump version.

BREAKING CHANGE: Use JSON instead of Protocol Buffers

Use JSON instead of Protocol Buffers for serializing messages from Stan.
Simplifies code considerably.

chore: Bump version

Bump version.

test: Verify a model with many parameters works

Check that a model with many parameters (160) works.
Prompted by a unusual bug in late 2020.

fix: Send entire message over the socket

Send the entire message over the socket. Previously, if the message was
larger than the send or receive buffer size (8192 bytes on macOS), a
partial message would be received.

After partial messages have been received, they need to be pieced
together. In particular, partial messages from the same writer/logger
need to be kept together.

fix: Correct dependencies for httpstan/stan_services.o

Correct dependencies for httpstan/stan_services.o.

style: clang-format C++ files

This commit formats C++ files with:

clang-format -i -style="{ColumnLimit: 119}"

ci: Remove non-working Linux jobs with clang

Remove non-working Linux jobs with clang.  Exporting CC=clang is not
sufficient to have libraries be built using clang. So these CI jobs are
not doing what they intend to do.

chore: Bump version

Bump version.

ci: Switch to GitHub Actions

Run tests in GitHub Actions, testing against Linux (Ubuntu 20.04) and macOS (10.14).

docs: Describe Operation in greater detail.

Describe `Operation` in greater detail. Indicate
that users should learn about whether not a sampling run
has finished by checking the relevant operation.

Closes #413

feat: Compress draws and messages using LZ4

Compress draws and messages from Stan using LZ4.  Previously gzip was
used. (LZ4 is much faster than gzip.) This commit also removes
compression/decompression steps from the `load_fit` and `dump_fit`
functions. Cache functions should be as simple as possible. In
particular, they should not need to know the format of data being
stored.  That said, an indication of format remains in the filename
`jsonlines.lz4`.  This is unfortunate and should be addressed in a
future commit.

Closes #485

test: Exclude parts of code from coverage calculation

Exclude several sections of code from coverage calculation.  These
sections contain code that is repetitive or which is related to
debugging.

feat: Add log_prob method and endpoint

Given a model name, associated data and unconstrained parameters,
the log_prob endpoint will calculate and return the log probability
of the unconstrained parameters.

This feature is accompanied by two tests, both of which are based on
a simple Gaussian problem: the first test validates the log_prob endpoint
by comparing the output against the analytically derived log probability;
the second test validates the log_prob endpoint by comparing the output
against the log probability (lp__) extracted from a model fit.

Closes #113

ci: Remove Travis CI

Remove Travis CI. httpstan now uses GitHub Actions.

test: Use pyproject.toml for coverage

Use pyproject.toml instead of .coveragerc for coverage configuration.

ci: Adjust test step for new coverage config

Adjust test step for new coverage config.
More options are now configured in `pyproject.toml`.

test: Adjust ignored code for coverage calculation

Adjust ignored code for coverage calculation. Completes
work started in commit 5417907391c487ba910708f4af441f2209f3dfb8.

fix: Call log_prob method of model class

Previously, the log_prob endpoint called the
log_prob_propto method in the stan::model namespace.
This fix calls the log_prob method of the model class
instead.

feat: Add log_prob_grad method and endpoint

Given a model name, associated data and unconstrained parameters,
the log_prob_grad endpoint will calculate and return the gradient
of the unconstrained parameters.

This feature is accompanied by a test: the log_prob_grad endpoint is
validated on a simple Gaussian example, the test compares the output
of the endpoint against an analytical calculation of the gradient.

fix: Remove unnecessary memcpy and reorder logprob

Removes unncessary calls to the memcpy (we already copied from a vector of
doubles to a vector of stan::math::var). Slight reordering to return the
log probability after deleting model and var_context variables.

docs: Correct log_prob and log_prob_grad docstring

Minor changes to the docstrings of log_prob and log_prob_grad.

feat: Add write_array method and endpoint

Given a model name, associated data and unconstrained parameters,
the write_array endpoint will transform the sequence of unconstrained
parameters to their defined support, optionally including transformed
parameters and generated quantities.

chore: Bump version

Bump version.

docs: Make goals and non-goals clearer

Make httpstan's goals and non-goals clearer.

fix: Do not save messages from failed fits

Do not save any messages from failed sampling runs.
For example, if sampling starts but cannot continue because attempts
to find appropriate initial values are rejected, there will be some
(logger) messages saved to disk. The presence of these messages
confuses the cache machinery, which assumes the presence of messages
on disk indicates a successful fit. Deleting them avoids the problem.

There remains the problem of retrieving the logger messages associated
with the failed fit. It's possible that this is something someone might
want to do. Future work might address this. Such a user is also free to
use CmdStan.

Closes #452

ci: Use newer version of poetry

Use newer version of poetry. Bug with v1.1.0 appears to be resolved.

docs: Simplify development installation

Simplify development installation instructions.

test: Relax coverage fail_under

Effectively disable coverage `fail_under` by setting it to 20%.

The existing coverage setup has made developing httpstan harder.
Proposed additions which have tests would cause the coverage check to
fail.  It was not always clear what piece of code was not checked.

feat: Add transform_inits method and endpoint

Given a model name, associated data, and constrained parameter
values and their context, the transformed_inits endpoint will
unconstrain the constrained parameters from their defined
support to unconstrained space.

Avoid creating symlinks to shared libraries because these
risk being ignored by Python wheel builders.

refactor: Consistently name source code directories

Place source code directories in `httpstan/include` in a consistent way.
Follows the convention familiar from Unix-like systems. Users should
only need to add `httpstan/include` as a search path for third-party
source files. Previously many more search paths needed to be specified.

Closes #469

Test under Python 3.9.

fix: Use asyncio.get_running_loop everywhere

Use asyncio.get_running_loop everywhere. Elsewhere, in a similar call,
we use asyncio.get_running_loop. This commit eliminates the
inconsistency.  asyncio.get_running_loop is the function we want. It
raises an exception if an event loop does not exist.

Remove assertions for output arrays. This enables the use of zero dimensional arrays.

refactor: Use method names as they appear in Stan

Use method names as they appear in the generated Stan C++ code.
For example, the method `get_dims` should be called `get_dims`
everywhere. This will avoid needless confusion.

fix: Fix make parallel execution

Fix parallel execution with make. One rule needed to be updated.
Adjust CI script to use parallel execution so we know the problem
is solved.

Closes #557

chore: Update versions of dependencies

Update version of depended-upon packages.

chore: Bump version

Bump version.

fix: Require multiprocessing to use "fork"

Require multiprocessing to use the "fork" method for starting
new processes. This is the only version httpstan currently works
with. (macOS recently switched to "spawn" as the default.)

This follows the recommendation in the Python `multiprocessing`
documentation:

> A library which wants to use a particular start method should probably
> use get_context() to avoid interfering with the choice of the library
> user.

chore: Bump version

Bump version.

feat: Handle control-c with less noise

Interrupting sampling makes much less noise now as KeyboardInterrupt
is ignored by the worker processes. Commit also avoids
raising an additional exception when a KeyboardInterrupt stops
sampling.

Stopping sampling via control-c occurs in PyStan. This change
should not affect anyone using httpstan by itself.

fix: Use established idiom for deleting fits

Use the already established (Pythonic) idiom for deleting fits.

feat: Add context to initialization failed error

When Stan is unable to initialize a chain, it aborts with an
"Initialization failed" error message. Prior to issuing this error
message, Stan emits potentially useful informational messages, such as
"Rejecting initial value: Log probability evaluates to log(0)".
Previously, these messages were not included in the exception.

Closes #595

feat: Update Stan to 2.31.0, bump version

fix: Pin setuptools to avoid distutils error

The newest version of setuptools (65.6.x) breaks httpstan's code---that
has been working for years. This commit adds a version pin that should
be removed once the issue is resolved.

fix: Finish migration to setuptools

Finish migration from distutils to setuptools. Distutils
is being deprecated by Python.

There are minor differences between setuptools and distutils. These
differences are not well-documented.

This change appears to make things work.

A better approach would be to subclass build_ext, following the
guidelines in the setuptools documentation:

https://setuptools.pypa.io/en/latest/userguide/extension.html

Closes #631

fix: Adapt to Stan change: consistent error logging

Commit 5f4f01f74ada379e698e95784495c9d2a6853918 in stan-dev/stan makes
the following change:

> Currently, the services functions are inconsistent on whether or not
> they will throw an exception. The versions which accept num_chains
> should never throw, but the older ones will throw if initialization
> fails. This consistently puts utils::initialize in a try block.

> Additionally, we are currently using logger.info for messages which
> are errors, and in several places not logging an error where we could
> (e.g., the catch blocks accompanying the above trys).

For example, instead of throwing an exception with the message
"Initialization failed.", `hmc_nuts_dense_e_adapt` writes the
initialization failed messages to the logger and then returns a non-zero
error code (stan::services::error_codes::CONFIG).

The only confusing detail here is that some information is written using
`logger.warn` and other information is written using `logger.error`.

This commit updates httpstan code to adapt to this change.
